Class turboRegFinalAction

java.lang.Object
  turboRegFinalAction
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
 class turboRegFinalAction
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable

The purpose of this class is to allow access to the progress bar, since it is denied to the turboRegDialog class. It proceeds by wrapping turboRegDialog inside a thread that is under the main event loop control.

Field Summary
private  boolean accelerated
           
static int AUTOMATIC
          Automatic registration: the initial source landmarks are refined to minimize the mean-square error.
static int BATCH
          Batch registration: each slice of the source image is registered to the target image.

Constructor Detail

turboRegFinalAction

public turboRegFinalAction(turboRegDialog dialog)
Start a thread under the control of the main event loop. This thread has access to the progress bar, while methods called directly from within turboRegDialog do not because they are under the control of its own event loop.

Parameters:
dialog - Gives access to some utility methods within turboRegDialog.

turboRegFinalAction

public turboRegFinalAction(turboRegImage sourceImg,
                           turboRegMask sourceMsk,
                           turboRegPointHandler sourcePh,
                           turboRegImage targetImg,
                           turboRegMask targetMsk,
                           turboRegPointHandler targetPh,
                           int transformation)
Start a thread under the control of the main event loop.

Method Detail

getThread

public java.lang.Thread getThread()
Return the thread associated with this turboRegFinalAction object.

run

public void run()
Start under the control of the main event loop, pause as long as the dialog event loop is active, and resume processing when turboRegDialog finally dies.

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable
